author: pulp1559
content: According to the spec, if the user requested a full withdrawal but there are pending withdrawals, it will be ~~ignored~~ postponed (as per https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/a09d0c321550c5411557674a981e2b444a1178c0/specs/electra/beacon-chain.md?plain=1#L1492). I wonder if the same would happen if there's a pending deposit in the queue? Or would it be lost/burnt if deposit queue is too long?

author: m.kalinin
content:
Pending withdrawal request will be *skipped* in this case and will have to be re-submitted by the user in order to trigger the exit
If there is a pending deposit in the queue and full exit happens then, once the deposit is applied, the sweep will withdraw all the non-zero balance once validator becomes withdrawable (current_epoch >= withdrawable_epoch)
